titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Ernest V. Joiner Papers, 1911-1997
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The papers of Ernest V. Joiner, an outspoken editor for a number of newspapers.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Ernest V. Joiner, born August 20, 1911 in Seymour, Texas, was an outspoken editor for a number of newspapers, such as the Ralls Banner (Texas), the Sebastopol Times (California), and the Lincoln County News (New Mexico). He graduated from Texas Technological College (now Texas Tech University) with a degree in Mass Communications and was a member of the Texas Tech Hall of Fame. Joiner's brand of editorial wit was always controversial, and he reached prominence due to his opinionated columns. The Joiner Papers will serve those interested in the life and times of one of the most outspoken editors of the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers from Ernest V. Joiner's collection consist of correspondence, editorial news clippings, financial materials, photographs (photocopies), plaques, awards, scrapbooks, and memorabilia. Transferred to the audio/visual department were four oral history tapes of interviews with Joiner.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ernest V. Joiner Papers, 1911-1997, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas
